file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-24-00-05 - YAW TRIM ACTUATOR - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL YAW TRIM ACTUATOR - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the operational check of the yaw trim. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 27-24-00-700-801-A YAW TRIM - OPERATIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-24-00 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-24-00-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. YAW TRIM - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to do the operational check of the yaw trim. (2) Figure 501 give the location of the EICAS display and the YAW TRIM switch. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Energize the aircraft with the External DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Pressurize the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). J. Operational Check of the Yaw Trim (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the operational check of the yaw trim. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 27-24-00 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Move the YAW TRIM switch to the LEFT position. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the arrow of the YAW TRIM indication moves to the left. NOTE: The system cycle time is limited in three seconds, after this time you must to release the switch and move it again to get another cycle. (b) Release the YAW TRIM switch; it goes to neutral position by itself. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the arrow of the YAW TRIM indication remains at last position. (c) Move the YAW TRIM switch to the RIGHT position. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the arrow of the YAW TRIM indication goes from LEFT to RIGHT position. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Release the pressure of the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200).
